content:
brettcannon edited issue #6107:

https://github.com/brettcannon/cpython-wasi-build/actions/runs/4537029209/jobs/7994435778#step:3:1 are the logs where the shell script doesn't seem to know what the latest release is.

alexcrichton commented on issue #6107:

The detection of the current verison, while crude, at least works locally for me. Is this a persistent error for you? I could imagine that the curl there, if it failed transiently, would cause this error. In such a case though it would be unlikely to happen twice in a row.

brettcannon commented on issue #6107:

Yep, that was it! Sorry about the noise.

brettcannon closed issue #6107:

https://github.com/brettcannon/cpython-wasi-build/actions/runs/4537029209/jobs/7994435778#step:3:1 are the logs where the shell script doesn't seem to know what the latest release is.
